articles.title: Kang Sok Ju Appointed as Vice PM
articles.content:
Kang Sok Ju Appointed as Vice PM
 Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- Kang Sok Ju was appointed as Vice-premier of the Cabinet of the DPRK, according to the decree of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly dated September 23.

articles.title: New First Vice FM and Vice FM Appointed
articles.content:
New First Vice FM and Vice FM Appointed
 Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- Kim Kye Gwan was appointed as First Vice-minister of Foreign Affairs and Ri Yong Ho as Vice- minister of Foreign Affairs, according to the decree of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK dated September 23.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Guinea-Bissau President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Guinea-Bissau President
 Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, sent a message of greetings to Malam Bacai Sanha, president of Guinea-Bissau, on Sept. 21 on the occasion of the 37th anniversary of the proclamation of the Republic of Guinea-Bissau. 
					 Kim Yong Nam in his message expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would steadily grow stronger and sincerely wished the president and people of Guinea-Bissau greater success in their work for peace and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Talks between WPK and CPGB (ML) Held
articles.content:
Talks between WPK and CPGB (ML) Held
 Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- Talks between the delegations of the Workers' Party of Korea and the Communist Party of Great Britain (Marxist-Leninist) were held in Pyongyang on Thursday.
					 Present at the talks from the WPK side were Department Director Kim Yong Il and officials of the Central Committee of the WPK and the CPGB (ML) side members of the delegation of the Communist Party of Great Britain (Marxist-Leninist) led by General Secretary Zane Carpenter.
					
					 At the talks both sides informed each other of the activities of their parties and exchanged views on further developing the relations between the two parties and matters of mutual concern.

articles.title: Gift from CPGB (ML) Delegation
articles.content:
Gift from CPGB (ML) Delegation
 Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by the visiting delegation of the Communist Party of Great Britain (Marxist-Leninist).
					 The gift was handed to Department Director of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea Kim Yong Il by General Secretary of the Communist Party of Great Britain (Marxist-Leninist) Zane Carpenter who is heading the delegation on Thursday.

articles.title: Lao Party Delegation Here
articles.content:
Lao Party Delegation Here
 Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Commission for External Affairs of the Central Committee of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party led by Vice-Chairman Thongsy Inthaphonh arrived here on Thursday. 
					 Kun Anthony Namkung, senior advisor to the governor of the State of New Mexico of the United States of America, also arrived here on the same day.

articles.title: Press Conference Held at Cuban Embassy
articles.content:
Press Conference Held at Cuban Embassy
 Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- A press conference took place at the Cuban embassy in the DPRK on Thursday as regards the issue of forcing the U.S. to lift blockade against Cuba and release five Cuban patriots held in the U.S. prison.
					 Present there were Choe Han Chun, vice-chairman of the Central Committee of the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea who doubles as chairman of the Korean Committee for the Release of Cuban Patriots, media-persons in the fields of the press, telecommunications and radio in Pyongyang and officials concerned.
					
					 Staff members of the Cuban embassy were also present there.
					
					 Jose Manuel Galego Montano, Cuban ambassador to the DPRK, in his speech at the press conference referred to the fact that the struggle for the release of the Cuban patriots unreasonably detained in the U.S. is going on in many countries.
					
					 He said that the Cuban people are waging an indomitable struggle against the vicious moves of the U.S., expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between Cuba and the DPRK would grow stronger in the future, too.
					
					 Then Choe Han Chun spoke next.
					
					 The ambassador answered to the questions raised by reporters at the press conference.

articles.title: Day of Germany Observed
articles.content:
Day of Germany Observed
 Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- A cultural event on the Day of Germany was held at the Pyongyang Centre for Cultural Exchange with Foreign Countries on Thursday on the occasion of the national day of Germany. 
					 Present at the event were Hong Son Ok, vice-chairwoman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries who doubles as chairwoman of the DPRK-Germany Friendship Association, and officials in the fields of science, education and public health. 
					
					 On hand were Gerhard Thiedemann, German ambassador to the DPRK, and staff members of the German embassy here, and other German guests. 
					
					 Speeches were made there. 
					
					 Speakers referred to the fact that exchange and cooperation in the field of culture have become brisk since the establishment of diplomatic ties between the DPRK and Germany and expressed the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow strong thanks to joint efforts. 
					
					 There were speeches underscoring the need to boost the relations of exchange and cooperation between the two countries in the field of culture.

articles.title: World First Aid Day Observed
articles.content:
World First Aid Day Observed
 Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- An event took place at the Taedonggang Diplomatic Corps Club Thursday on World First Aid Day.
					 Present there were officials of the DPRK Red Cross Society and the delegation of the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies and members of the International Committee of the Red Cross working in the DPRK.
					
					 A first aid workshop was held for Red Cross officials at the event.
					
					 Theoretical and practical issues on the first aid in the populated areas were introduced at the workshop.
					
					 Then followed speeches on Red Cross activities including the dissemination of knowledge about first aid.

articles.title: Mass Sports Activities Brisk
articles.content:
Mass Sports Activities Brisk
 Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- During the months of the people's physical strength examination (August and September), mass sports activities have become brisker in the country.
					 Industrial establishments have fully provided its employees with sports facilities, while giving them general knowledge of physical training. 
					
					 The Kim Jong Thae Electric Locomotive Complex and the Pyongyang Automation Instrument Factory have invited their workers to running, health-promoting Taekwon-Do exercise and mass rhythmic gymnastics on a regular basis.
					
					 The Pyongyang Thermal Power Complex, the Chollima Steel Complex and the Pyongyang Textile Mill have organized hurdling and other games to help their employees train themselves mentally and physically for national defence. 
					
					 The Rihyon Vegetable Co-op Farm in Sadong District, Pyongyang, and the Migok Co-op Farm in Sariwon City have encouraged such national sports games as ssirum (Korean wrestling), tug of war and seesaw among peasants. 
					
					 Sports activities have been invigorated in educational institutions, too.

articles.title: Technical Achievements Made
articles.content:
Technical Achievements Made
 Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- Many technical achievements have been made in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea to lend impetus to the economic growth.
					 Agricultural scientists and technicians have bred new strains of high-yield grain and made efficacious microbiological fertilizers and organic fertilizers to contribute to increasing the agricultural production.
					
					 They have also established scientific farming methods such as the use of mud snails in the weeding of rice paddies and invented many modern and efficient farm machines.
					
					 Scientists in the sector of light industry, together with workers, have put production processes on the CNC basis, while improving the quality of the products and expanding their variety.
					
					 Hundreds of valuable inventions have been made in the four key sectors of national economy -- metal, power and coal industries and railways transport -- in the first half of the year to add much to the management and production activities.
					
					 Technical achievements of practical significance have been registered in the sector of chemical industry, including a computer control system introduced into the anthracite gasification process.
					
					 Remarkable successes have also been reported from the fields of IT, Nano-technology and biological engineering.

articles.title: Taffy Made with Medicinal Herb
articles.content:
Taffy Made with Medicinal Herb
 Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- The Korean Koryo Medicine Technical Center has made taffy with Cynanchum wilfordii, a medicinal herb.
					 It, a haematinic and tonic, is efficacious for the prevention and treatment of such diseases as weakness, neurasthenia, anaemia, chronic colitis and cancer.
					
					 Cynanchum wilfordii, a perennial creeper belonging to Asclepiadaceae, has long been used for Koryo medicine as its nutritive roots have a pharmacological action. 
					
					 In particular, the plant contains ingredients preventing aging and restraining tumor.

articles.title: Japan's "2010 Defense White Paper" Blasted
articles.content:
Japan's "2010 Defense White Paper" Blasted
 Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- Japan in its "2010 Defense White Paper" reiterated its claim to Tok Islets and pulled up the DPRK over the nuclear and missile issues. This was a revelation of the criminal scenarios to openly grab the islets and realize its ambition to emerge a military giant and launch reinvasion.
					 Rodong Sinmun Thursday says this in a signed commentary.
					
					 Japan's assertions are as despicable and absurd as the false propagandas conducted in the past, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 The undisguised moves of the Japanese reactionaries to seize Tok Islets are aimed at inventing a pretext for staging a comeback to Korea.
					
					 They are becoming so foolish as to turn the issue of Tok Islets into a territorial dispute in a bid to internationalize it and secure a legitimate pretext for reinvading Korea.
					
					 Lurking behind the Japanese reactionaries' trumpeting about the non-existent "nuclear threat" from somebody is a black-hearted intention to cover up the truth about their own nuclear issue under that pretence and carry out their nuclear weaponization at any cost behind the scene of the row. 
					
					 Japan has nuclear technology and facilities and has stockpiled plutonium enough to make thousands of nukes. The Japanese militarists are set to achieve their criminal goal with nuclear sticks any time as they are watching for a chance to launch reinvasion, obsessed with an extreme zeal to take revenge and wild ambition for overseas expansion. 
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries regard the establishment of the missile defense system as an important link in the chains of the efforts to round off the preparations for overseas aggression. 
					
					 It goes without saying that they in the "defense white paper" expressed "concern" about the nuclear and missile issues of the DPRK because they deemed it necessary for creating the consciousness of crisis among the Japanese people in an effort to justify MD. 
					
					 The "2010 Defense White Paper" published at a time when "a strong counter-action" against  the DPRK is advocated among the U.S. and Japanese reactionary ruling quarters would only result in upsetting security and military equilibrium in Northeast Asia and increasing the danger of war on the Korean Peninsula. 
					
					 It is the revolutionary mettle of the army and people of the DPRK to meet the aggressors' challenge with a thousand-fold crushing blow. The Japanese reactionaries would be well advised to think twice over the serious consequences to be entailed by their reckless moves to grab other's territory, emerge a military giant and stage a comeback to Korea and stop them.

articles.title: Actions for Saving Korean Relations Called for
articles.content:
Actions for Saving Korean Relations Called for
 Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- It is an urgent task facing the Korean nation to save the relations between the north and the south from a collapse and open up a new turning phase for independent reunification, says Rodong Sinmun Thursday in a signed article.
					 Only improved north-south relations can help defuse the danger of a war and achieve independent and peaceful reunification by the concerted efforts of all Koreans, the article says, and goes on:
					
					 The present reality in which the inter-Korean relations have been driven to the worst situation where there is neither dialogue nor cooperation is not beneficial to anyone. Consistent is the stand of the DPRK to improve the north-south relations and achieve the peace and reunification of the country on the basis of the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration.
					
					 What is urgent at present for implementing these declarations and improving the north-south relations is to ensure detente and peace. Only when tension is eased and peaceful atmosphere created, is it possible to pave the way for implementing the above-said declarations and significantly improving the north-south relations.
					
					 The inter-Korean relations can never improve as long as war exercises aimed to do harm to fellow countrymen are underway. Only when the policy of confrontation with the DPRK is replaced by the policy of reconciliation through alliance with the north and all hostile acts against the DPRK including war exercises are put to an end, can the inter-Korean relations turn into those of reconciliation and cooperation, the article concludes.

articles.title: Anniversary of Demise of Kim Jong Suk Commemorated
articles.content:
Anniversary of Demise of Kim Jong Suk Commemorated
 Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- The Bangladesh Institute of the Juche Idea issued a bulletin on Sept. 16 on the occasion of the 61st anniversary of demise of Kim Jong Suk, anti-Japanese heroine.
					 The life of Kim Jong Suk was the life characterized by loyalty to President Kim Il Sung and devoted service to the country and people, the bulletin said, and went on:
					
					 Kim Jong Suk, upon embarking on the road of revolution in her early years, protected Kim Il Sung with arms in her hand and held him in high esteem and devoted her all to the struggle for accomplishing the revolutionary cause started by him. She was an outstanding woman revolutionary, anti-Japanese heroine and great mother of Korea.
					
					 Kim Jong Suk worked heart and soul for the founding and strengthening of the regular forces of the country true to the line of Kim Il Sung on building an army after the liberation of Korea.
					
					 Thanks to the feats Kim Jong Suk performed by giving birth to the lodestar of Juche the Korean people have been blessed with the illustrious leaders generation after generation and become proud of firmly carrying forward the tradition of Mt. Paektu.
					
					 The Korean people are waging a dynamic struggle to build a thriving socialist nation under the leadership of General Secretary Kim Jong Il, holding Kim Il Sung in high esteem as the eternal sun of Juche true to the wish of Kim Jong Suk in her lifetime.

articles.title: RPDC nombra a Kang Sok Ju como vicepremier
articles.content:
RPDC nombra a Kang Sok Ju como vicepremier
Pyongyang, 23 de septiembre (ATCC) -- Segun el decreto fechado 23 del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kang Sok Ju fue asignado como vicepremier del Consejo de Ministros de la RPDC.

articles.title: RPDC nombra nuevo primer vicecanciller y vicecanciller
articles.content:
RPDC nombra nuevo primer vicecanciller y vicecanciller
Pyongyang, 23 de septiembre (ATCC) -- Segun el decreto fechado 23 del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Kye Gwan fue asignado como primer vicecanciller y Ri Yong Ho, como vicecanciller.

articles.title: Conversaciones entre delegaciones de partido de Corea y Gran Bretana
articles.content:
Conversaciones entre delegaciones de partido de Corea y Gran Bretana
 Pyongyang, 23 de septiembre (ATCC) -- Tuvieron lugar el dia 23 en esta capital las conversaciones entre las delegaciones del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y del Partido Comunista de Gran Bretana (Marxista-Leninista).
					 En la ocasion estuvieron presentes por la parte coreana el jefe de departamento Kim Yong Il y otros funcionarios del Comite Central del PTC, y por la britanica, los miembros de la delegacion del  citado partido encabezada por el secretario general Zane Carpenter.
					
					 Ambas partes se informaron el estado de actividades de sus respectivos partidos e intercambiaron las opiniones sobre el mayor desarrollo de las relaciones entre ambos partidos y los problemas de interes mutuo.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun critica la "carta blanca de defensa" de Japon
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun critica la "carta blanca de defensa" de Japon
Pyongyang, 23 de septiembre (ATCC) -- En la recien publicada "Carta blanca de defensa para 2010", Japon volvio a insistir en el "derecho a la posesion del islote Tok" y acuso el problema nuclear y el de misiles de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea (RPDC).
					 Esto parte del intento criminal de Japon de arrebatar el territorio ajeno, convertirse en una potencia militar y lanzar la nueva agresion. 
					
					 Asi senala el periodico Rodong Sinmun en un comentario individual del dia 23 y continua:
					
					 Lo que ha insistido esta vez ese pais isleno es tan sucio y absurdo como sus anteriores demagogias.
					
					Al armar un litigio territorial en torno al islote Tok, los reaccionarios japoneses tratan de internacionalizar este tema y procurar asi el pretexto legal de la nueva agresion a Corea.
					
					 Ellos hablan tanto del rumor de la supuesta "amenaza nuclear" de alguien para ocultar los verdaderos aspectos del problema nuclear de Japon y completar por detras el armamento nuclear. 
					
					 Japon ha investigado y desarrollado las tecnicas e instalaciones nucleares y posee el plutonio en una cantidad suficiente para fabricar miles de artefactos nucleares. 
					
					 Los militaristas japoneses pretenden alcanzar con el garrote nuclear su meta criminal de retomar el camino de agresion a ultramar para satisfacer su extremado animo revanchista.
					
					  En este contexto, conceden mucha importancia al establecimiento del sistema antimisiles.
					
					  Para justificarlo sembrando en los habitantes japoneses la conciencia de crisis, expresaron en la arriba referida "carta blanca" la "preocupacion" del problema nuclear y el de misiles de la RPDC.
					
					La publicacion de esta "carta blanca", que coincide con el reclamo de los gobernantes reaccionarios de EE.UU. y Japon por el "enfrentamiento intransigente" con la RPDC, servira solo para destruir la seguridad y el equilibrio militar en la region del Nordeste Asiatico y aumentar el peligro de guerra en la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					  El ejercito y el pueblo de Corea tienen el temperamento revolucionario de responder con el golpe aniquilador mil veces mas fuerte al desafio de los agresores.
					
					  Los reaccionarios japoneses deben parar sus imprudentes e inutiles acciones pensando bien en sus graves consecuencias.
